thread.title: That Saturday air travel mess blamed on Lockheed glitch
thread.title_full: That Saturday air travel mess blamed on Lockheed glitch

author: Naomi Eide
title: That Saturday air travel mess blamed on Lockheed glitch
text:
Andrew Harrer The Aug. 15 air traffic control system shutdown caused almost 1,000 canceled flights,… more The Federal Aviation Administration, FAA, has identified a software upgrade as the cause of Saturday’s airport chaos, which created cancellations and delays across the East Coast. The FAA’s software contractor, Maryland-based Lockheed Martin Corp. (NYSE: LMT), recently upgraded the air route automation system to allow individual air traffic controllers to create a customized window for frequently used data, according to the FAA. Lockheed and the FAA are working to find a more permanent solution to the software glitch, but in the meantime the FAA suspended use of the function. For the full story visit the Washington Business Journal.
